explanation: To decide if OS_CondVarWait can violate the <string.h> bounds rule you must analyze its callees and the data they manipulate plus any test-stub infrastructure that may be invoked.  - OS_ObjectIdGetById: Direct callee; its implementation may perform string operations or copy object names/fields.  - OS_CondVarWait_Impl: Direct callee; may perform operations (including string/memory funcs) on the token or related structures.  - OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit, OS_ObjectIdToArrayIndex, OS_ObjectIdConvertToken, OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel: Transitive callees of OS_ObjectIdGetById; their bodies must be inspected for any use of memcpy/strcpy/strlen/etc. or for pointer/index arithmetic that could result in out-of-bounds accesses.  - OS_ObjectIndexFromToken: Callee of OS_CondVarWait_Impl; may index arrays or manipulate token contents (possible string/memory operations).  - OS_object_token_t, osal_id_t: Types passed between the functions; you need their field layout to know whether any string/memory operations act on buffers and what their sizes are.  - OS_LOCK_MODE_NONE, OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR, OS_SUCCESS: Constants used as parameters/return values; their semantics can affect control flow (e.g., early return vs. deeper execution) and thus whether string functions are reached.  - UT_Stub_RegisterReturnType, UT_Stub_RegisterContextWithMetaData, UT_ExecuteBasicHandler, UT_Stub_GetReturnValuePtr and their helpers (UT_GetStubEntry, UT_ClearStubEntry, UtAssert_Abort, UtAssert_GetContext, UT_SetHandlerFunction, UT_DefaultStubImpl): These unit-test / stub facilities appear in the static call graph for the target; the production or test-time variants might call string.h routines (for logging, copying context metadata, default implementations). Include them to ensure no indirect string/memory operations are missed.  Inspecting the implementations and the exact type/size of any buffer fields is necessary to determine whether any string.h calls could access beyond object bounds.
